thread.title: OKC-based company Kimray announces 15% reduction in workforce
thread.title_full: OKC-based company Kimray announces 15% reduction in workforce

author: Jonathan Greco
title: OKC-based company Kimray announces 15% reduction in workforce
text: The Oklahoma City-based oil and gas control equipment manufacturer Kimray announced that it is reducing its workforce by 15 percent, impacting about 120 employees. >> Get the latest news stories of interest by clicking here.In a news release, Kimray officials said the reduction is to "narrow its focus on core business functions and strategic priorities." The reduction impacts all areas â€“ including administration, sales, production and production support. "While there has been a softening in the oil and gas market, there is still a healthy demand for our product. After evaluating our long-term goals, we decided to focus more on Kimray's core business. This means reducing our staff and reorganizing our teams," Kimray CEO Thomas Hill III said in the news release. "This difficult decision is necessary for the long-term health of the company. We have employed thousands of people during our 75 years of business, and each one contributed to what Kimray is today. It is an honor to share life with so many wonderful people." >> Download the KOCO 5 AppKimray President Bob Cole added that the company will provide job placement and counseling services to help impacted employees find new jobs.
